result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance G Oligney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

timeConds.notes:
Pursuant to 303.08 Work Release/Huber privileges.

Must be served during term of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 10:08 Defendant Lance G Oligney in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing at 04-13-2015 10:00 am

10:24 Attorney Travis Stephen Slattery in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Slattery asks for adjournment due to defendant's medical appointment. State does not object.
Court grants adjournment to next week. Bond is continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Plea hearing on April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

8:38 Attorney Travis Stephen Slattery in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Slattery states that defendant is in the hospital today. He states defendant intended to enter a plea today.
Court grants adjournment.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lance G Oligney in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.    Bond continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.

11:31 Defendant Lance G Oligney in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Todd Andrys is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Wis Rapids Police Dept.  Testifies to knowing Lance Oligney and identifies him in the courtroom.  Testifies to drug transaction that took place on 02/26/2013 with a CI, Detective Schultz and Lance Oligney.  Testifies to the exchange being for a white chunky substance that was tested positive for cocaine.  Testifies to how Det Schultz identified Lance Oligney.  Testifies to transaction that took place on 04/18/13.  Testifies to substance exchanged and to test being positive for cocaine.  Lance Oligney was identified by individual that did exchange.  

Atty Slattery cross examines the witness.  Testifies to last contact with Lance Oligney.  Did not personally observe transactions that took place.  

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for Arraignment.
(Defendant)
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
